meanings.meaning: 1. dot; spot; point; speck; mark どんな小さな点でも見ることができる。I can see the tiniest spot.
2. mark (in an exam, etc.); grade; score; points 合格した生徒の名前の前に点をつけて下さい。Will you put a dot before the names of the successful students?
3. point (in a game); score; goal; run 我々のチームが２点リードしている。Our team is two points ahead.
4. point Geometry
5. point; aspect; matter; detail; part; respect; way; viewpoint 博識の点で彼に及ぶものはいない。No one can approach him in wideness of knowledge.
6. (punctuation) mark (e.g. comma, period, decimal point); dot
7. "dot" stroke (in a Chinese character)
8. counter for points, marks, goals, etc.
9. counter for goods, items, articles of clothing, works of art, etc. 彼女のギャラリーに２点ほど出展するのよ。I'm going to have two pieces in her gallery.
1. dot; point; mark Usually written using kana alone
2. gidayū musicians Kabuki, Usually written using kana alone, See also 義太夫
チョボ
点: Rarely-used kanji form.
1. dot; spot; point; speck; mark どんな小さな点でも見ることができる。I can see the tiniest spot.
2. mark (in an exam, etc.); grade; score; points 合格した生徒の名前の前に点をつけて下さい。Will you put a dot before the names of the successful students?
3. point (in a game); score; goal; run 我々のチームが２点リードしている。Our team is two points ahead.
4. point Geometry
5. point; aspect; matter; detail; part; respect; way; viewpoint 博識の点で彼に及ぶものはいない。No one can approach him in wideness of knowledge.
6. (punctuation) mark (e.g. comma, period, decimal point); dot
7. "dot" stroke (in a Chinese character)
8. counter for points, marks, goals, etc.
9. counter for goods, items, articles of clothing, works of art, etc. 彼女のギャラリーに２点ほど出展するのよ。I'm going to have two pieces in her gallery.

sentences.translation: I can see the tiniest spot.
Will you put a dot before the names of the successful students?
Our team is two points ahead.
No one can approach him in wideness of knowledge.
I'm going to have two pieces in her gallery.

meanings.meaning: 1. dot; point; mark
2. tip; gratuity Kansai dialect, Only applies to ぽち
3. a little; paltry; piddling; mere Only applies to ぽち, See also ぽっち, after a quantity or demonstrative pronoun; oft. as っぽち

1. marks; points; score; grade; runs (baseball)

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ku' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to be lit (of a lamp, burner, etc.); to catch fire; to ignite; to start burning Usually written using kana alone, See also 付く木造建築物は火がつきやすい。Wooden buildings catch fire easily.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ku' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to be turned on (of a light, appliance, etc.); to come on Usually written using kana alone灯りが一晩中ついている。The lights have been burning all night.

1. face; official stance; public position or attitude (as opposed to private thoughts) See also 本音少数民族の雇用促進政策とはいっても、建前にすぎず、現状はマイノリティーが職に就けるチャンスなどほとんどない。Although many pay lip service to the idea of affirmative action, in reality, very few minorities get hired.
2. ceremony for the erection of the framework of a house Only applies to 建前, Only applies to 建て前
建て前 【たてまえ】、立前 【たてまえ】、立て前 【たてまえ】

sentences.translation: Although many pay lip service to the idea of affirmative action, in reality, very few minorities get hired.

meanings.meaning: 1. here and there; little by little; sporadically; scattered in drops 池に落ち葉が点々と浮かんでいた。The pond was dotted with fallen leaves.
2. dots; spots
点点 【てんてん】

sentences.translation: The pond was dotted with fallen leaves.

1. raindrops; falling drop of water 点滴石を穿つ。Constant dripping wears away a stone.
2. intravenous drip; IV; drip-feed Medicine, Abbreviation, See also 点滴注射私は病院で点滴を受けた。I had an intravenous drip in hospital.

sentences.translation: Constant dripping wears away a stone.
I had an intravenous drip in hospital.
